name: Market Hotel

reviews.text: Very personable staff. Bottles of water and apples a nice touch. Pleasant dining room. Loved that we could walk everywhere including the Born, Ramblas, and Poble Sec and Barcenoleta. Down side was the smell--Natural gas--that seeped in the hotel causing the housekeeper to clean our room with the windows open. Also, the hotel is in the process of adding rooms in what is still an apartment building. For three of the seven nights, construction started at 7 in the morning, waking us up. The first time it happened, the desk offered to switch our room, which I kindly pointed out was not what we wanted as we were asleep. The staff went and asked the worker to stop. The second and third time it happened, the desk said they could do nothing about it as it wasn't their workers causing the problem. Well, it IS the hotel"s problem,because everyone on the floor could hear it. We should have been compensated in some way for this thrice disturbance, but I did not press further. Also, there are no carpets in the hotel, so you hear people walking up and down the halls at all hours as well and hearing guest's nighttime activities till the wee hours was not conducive to sleep. I slept with earplugs most nights. The hotel is very clean, beautifully appointed and the shower/tub was the best of any hotel I've stayed in.
reviews.title: high design and great location--Noise is a problem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A very unique hotel. The room is very cozy and beautiful..Bathroom was awesome.. Stayed there for 3 nights.. Very reasonable price and great location.
reviews.title: Great hotel !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just got back from a week in Spain and spent it at the Market Hotel. What a fantastic place! Great staff; small, but well appointed rooms with awesome showers. Be careful about getting a room overlooking the street, however, as it can get really noisy...especially between 4:30AM and 6AM when all the trucks are making deliveries to the market.
reviews.title: Great Hotel! Great Value!

reviews.text: The restaurant in the hotel is excellent also, but be sure to make reservations, as they fill up quickly. I'd skip the breakfast. For 9 euros, you can get better breakfasts anywhere else. There's a great little place directly across the street with pastries, sandwiches and coffee.
reviews.title: Quirky n cool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will definitely stay at this place again!
reviews.title: Great at the price - but get the right room!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Since we stepped into this tastefully designed hotel, we liked it. Check-in went fast and in 10 minutes we were in our room. Front desk staff was very helpfull, room was big enough, bed was very comfortable and bathroom was shining. There are 2 metro stops nearby, but we walked nearly all the time to Las Ramblas. When you visit Hotel Market, have a drink in a bar or outside in a lounge. Free wifi, apples, water and hotel bag was nice touch:)
reviews.title: wow wow wow- will definitely get back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If it weren't for one significant problem, this would be a 5 start review. The probkem in fact is lack of sound insulation in rooms which, particularly for the lower floors where there is no double glazing, can make for a loud morning. We happened to be woken up by building works above our room (the building houses both the hotel and several private apartments) which went on apparently without the knowledge of management. Management , however, was apologetic and quick to find us another room. Having said all that this is an otherwise wonderful hotel, beautifully designed, relaxed, with a great restaurant and bar. Although the food is excellent and presented in a high class manner it is very inexpensive (most expensive wine on the menu was 14 euros!) . The bar and small terrace outside have been recently opened and are a very pleassant place to hang out and spend some time before or after dinner. Rooms are large, with high ceilings and solid wood floors. Bathrooms are superb with powerful, rain showers, good quality toiletries and thick cotton towels. My wife, an architect, noticed that all the details are right from the workmanship of the tiles to the design of the lights and furniture.
reviews.title: Wonderful, hidden gem of a hotel

reviews.text: Service is very eager even if English is not perfect. Breakfast is excellent with freshly baked pastries as well as frsh chopped tomatoes in olive oil. Wifi is free.
reviews.title: Great hotel & helpful staff

reviews.text: Finally, the best thing about this hotel... the price we paid: 65 euros/night for a double room. Nuff said.
reviews.title: Worthwhile Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My friend and I only stayed for one night but our experience was great. The room was spacious, modern and beautifully decorated. The location is a little difficult to find since the entrance is through an alley. Hell of a time trying to find that alley. My only complaints are 1) they gave us one bed instead of two and 2) the walls are EXTREMELY thin! Think twice before you consider this a "romantic" stay. We only had a paella from the restaurant and that was with room service so cannot comment on the restaurant itself. But the paella was good if a little too salty. But I found all food in Spain too salty.
reviews.title: Good comfortable hotel in quiet but central location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Be realistic - this is a modest, 3-star European hotel in a converted building. It has resuling limitations. But if you're realistic in your expecations, it's a fine place. Courteous and helpful staff, well-maintained rooms, conveneint nearby subway stop (Urgell, not Sant Antoni, is much more convenient for most purposes), good individual air conditioning, The neighboord is kind of working class, but not scary as some have reported. The hotel restaurant offers great food at excellent prices - full of locals who obviously think the same thing. Limitations: It faces more an alley than a street, so no view at all and the alley can be an echo chamber for noise. Because it takes a change of elevators to get to most rooms, you will usually end up using lots of stairs, and you will probably get lost the first time. Biggest "problem" is that the hotel oversells itself on it web site. It is smaller, older, and more basic than it wants you to think. (Our room was very clean, but it had not seen basic maintenance for some time.) Still a good solid *** hotel, but false expectations are not good
reviews.title: Excellent if you have realistic expectations.
Hip friendly hotel and great value for money
reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in early June and loved it. The staff were friendly, rooms comfortable, great shower and it did not feel boxy. Had a fabulous lunch in the restuarant for a very reasonable 9 euros. Location was not too touristy which we liked and an easy walk to public transport. Nice touch with free water and apples. Overall very good vaue for money but not the place for someone after high end luxury.

We stayed here from March 25th till 28th.The hotel is located in the centre and the Ramblas is on walking distance. Hotel is nicely furnished and the staff are very friendly and helpful. Hotel seems a bit amateuristic quite a few times. Breakfast is ok but not steady. They forgot to clean our room and we never received a proper apology or compensation. The rooms are extremely noisy and the airconditioning does not work properly.
reviews.title: Can be much better and very noisy!

reviews.text: I loved everything about this hotel until I was checking out. A couple came running into the lobby out of breath and visibly upset as they had just been robbed and held at knife point.
reviews.title: Was perfect until the very end

reviews.text: I read other reviews about this hotel being in an unsafe and sketchy area but decided to stay here regardless because of the look of the hotel and the price. I didn't feel that the area was sketchy during the day, however, my girlfriend and I didn't stay out late so we didn't really notice the area at night.
reviews.title: If only I could have slept!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we enjoyed our stay the staff was friendly helpful all that you want from a hotel staff
reviews.title: great place to stay, neighborhood feel, lovely staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: there was a fesdtival at the close by market which made it noisy one night
reviews.title: Many Good Qualities, But Noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: close to flea market, great food market that ran on for blocks, close to the metros and lots of neighborhood hangouts, not at all touristy
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, shame about noise and location
Be wary of NY Times review....what are people talking about?
reviews.text: We stayed at the Market Hotel for 3 nights and generally had a positive experience. The servie is quite good. Our room was large and interesting, with high ceilings and a wonderful shower in the bathroom area (separated from the main room by large sliding doors, one of which did not close entirely). We also experienced excellent service from the staff. The hotel has free Internet, which generally worked well during our stay. The restaurant in the hotel is also very good.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only negative aspect of our experience was noise. We had a room facing the alley that contains the hotel's front entrance. Our room was quite noisy until very late at night and also very noisy early in the morning. We recommend this hotel highly, but if you have problems with noise, you should pay close attention to the placement of your room.
reviews.title: Could be great but for noise

description: The Market Hotel & Restaurant has been open since October 2004, and although it functions normally and is working as if it were, it is not finished yet. At the moment it has 33 rooms, and at the end it will have about 80. All the rooms have full-equipped bathroom, air conditioning, central heating, cable TV, free internet access and phone, and although all they look similar, they are not all the same, and there are also different types of rooms.
